website_summaries.verdict: A budget-priced alternative to a bulky tree that your cat is sure to enjoy.
pros: A budget-priced tree that earns consistently high ratings
cons: Columns and base are made of "flimsy" cork board
Hammock is difficult to replace once it wears out

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves this!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my kitten, he's almost a year now and still loves this. Perfect height for a kitten yet still big enough and sturdy enough for an adult cat to scratch and sleep in. Good product
customer_reviews.author: dh

customer_reviews.title: Purrr fect!
customer_reviews.text: Both my 1 yr. old cats like it. They take turns on the hammock. I put a lambs wool cat bed below so they can both enjoy the spot. I had a different cat tree with a hammock so I knew they would like this one. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: It's Purrfect
customer_reviews.text: After rescuing a stray and her 6 kittens we needed to find a cheap, yet effective cat tree for them. All the kittens love it and enjoy (they're 6 weeks) and will climb the posts up to the hammock, play with the ball and some even sleep on it.
customer_reviews.author: NicholeTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: On our second tree
customer_reviews.text: My cat "Beefyboy" loves this tree. We have ordered two only because of the color, it is so light that after about a year it started looking a little discolored and this stays in the main living part of our house so we want it to look nice. I truly wish that it were available in other colors. Beefy lays in his probably at least ten hours of every day. The ball lasted about 2 days on each of them, it isn't on there very securely but that isn't a huge deal. I highly recommend this product for kitty happiness!
customer_reviews.author: tina

customer_reviews.title: Neither one of my cats like it. My 12 lb boy did jump in ...
customer_reviews.text: Neither one of my cats like it!! My 12 lb boy did jump in the hammock for a few minutes as he is very curious and has to try out everything but he hasn't been back. I think it is because it may be too small for him. My 7 lb girl does not like it at all, I've placed her in the hammock and she can't leave soon enough.It seems like they may not feel secure in it. No assembly instructions were included but there was a strange piece of paper that said if the instructions are not included to go to the website to download them, I went to the website and there are no instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Good quality good Price!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Good quality good price to start with. We bought this for our new kitten. He is still to tiny to just jump up into the resting area( which is soft) so he gets good use out of the scratching posts to climb up into the resting area. There is a tiny little fuzzy ball attached to the resting unit which he is very entertained with. The string is just the right length as to not be to long to possibly wrap around his neck and strangle him.
customer_reviews.author: tiggge

customer_reviews.title: Very pretty and soft
customer_reviews.text: After reading good and bad reviews, I didn't know what to expect but when I opened the box, I loved it. It is very well made, easy to put together (unless of course you are an idiot like myself and attach the base first lol). It turns out very pretty, I love the angled design. The fur is soft but not the kind where you can pull fibers out without even trying. This doesn't shed at all. The top part is actually sewn all around (not glued) and it is double fabric thickness. Also, the little corners over the posts are padded and soft which was a pleasant surprise. Overall, a great design and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: No instructions possible missing parts.
customer_reviews.text: No instructions. figured out how to attach bottom but not top. Only two screw enclosed. Went on line for instructions-computer warned me of possible security breach. I owe some one who gave me the correct instructions via outreach. It did not click in until I had taken a hot shower. If no instructions. Attach the soft bed first and once that is done then take the two screws and secure the bottom. Many thanx to the one who responded giving me the correct procedure.
customer_reviews.author: Alexa One/Cat Lady

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My very large cat (17 pounds) manages to curl up in this cat tree just fine. He likes to sit in it and watch birds outside. It gives him just enough height for a good view but is not overly bulky and in the way. It's pretty sturdy and I think it will last a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: L.A. Rioux

customer_reviews.title: Best thing I ever bought for my cats
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of these in my house. My two cats are obsessed with them and spend hours in them everyday taking naps. They feel super comfortable to my hand and my cats can confirm they are comfortable for cats to lay in. They use the scratching posts on a daily basis as well. Some things you buy for pets are a dud, they just get ignored. This isn’t one of those things, they’re probably the most successful purchase I’ve ever made for them.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Our cat and her scratching posts.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these tower/scratch posts that we have purchased for our cat and she loves each of them. Her first action on awakening is to stretch and then she goes for a brief scratching session. At nearly any time of day or evening, we will find her sleeping on this item or lurking Bout it’s base. These posts have been very popular with our cat.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Mason

customer_reviews.title: Happy cat
customer_reviews.text: My cat jumped on this the moment I took it out of the box. It has nice soft plushy texture and like the light color. Goes well in my home. Kitty was curious and took to it right away. Once I assembled it in about 5 minutes, she went in the little cubbyhole and played with her toys inside. She likes the little puff ball attached to the leg also and I like the sisal rope scratching material. Best for kitties clawing needs. She got on the hammock last night but hasn't slept in it yet. She will in time I'm sure. Happy kitty, happy kitty mommy:)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and furrballs loves it
customer_reviews.text: My sofa is finally saved. Box arrived a little beat up but that's more to with shipping. Everything was inside. The scratching posts are inside the hole along with the screws and a little tool. I made a mistake in assembly and screwed in the bottom first before realizing my mistake. The top or hammock part is to be screwed in first. It's a little bit tricky attaching the bottom when it starts to get tight. But with sheer determination should do it. It seems sturdy enough and supported my super fat cat's weight. They were immediately drawn to it and now my couch can finally be at peace with no impending disaster in place.
customer_reviews.author: ZP

customer_reviews.title: Kitty loves it
customer_reviews.text: This cat tree is super easy to assemble. Screw in the stands, then screw in the top. I don't remember the exact details because it's been a while since I assembled it. It's also sturdy and we haven't had any issues since. The cat loves it, he takes a nap on the big human bed then when he wakes up, he runs to stretch and scratch on the scratchers then hops up to the hammock and takes another nap. He's not very interested in the dangling ball but he occasionally plays with it. It's a great investment.
customer_reviews.author: K.K.

customer_reviews.title: My cats love it!
customer_reviews.text: My two cats typically don't take to anything quickly, so I was impressed that one almost immediately hopped up into the hammock portion and had a nap! The other one was in it the next day. I did use a little catnip as incentive, but that still does not usually happen. I am hoping that they take to the scratching posts as I've just gotten new furniture and ordered this item to encourage scratching in an appropriate place. It seems much sturdier than a single scratching post. It was received promptly, and assembled easily with four screws in about 5 minutes. I have ordered a second one since they like it so much!
customer_reviews.author: supperlady

customer_reviews.title: Cozy space for cat
customer_reviews.text: Our cat loves to lounge in every spot on this cat tree. We have it sitting on top of a trunk, next to a window, to give our kitty a perfect viewing spot out of a window. He will sit on the bottom underneath the hammock, and scratch the posts, and will also hop up into the hammock and lounge for hours, staring out the window. He doesn't play with the ball on the string too much, but every once in awhile he will randomly go wild over it. All in all this was a major win, it's one of our cat's favorite places to hang out in our home.
customer_reviews.author: C. Smitley

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, roomy, and fun for cats!
customer_reviews.text: My kitties love this tower. They went straight to it and started playing. I put it on our back porch that we are building so they could lay there if they wanted a jump on the window sill. They like sleeping in the hammock. I spray a little cat nip on it from time to time and that’s fun to watch. They are big cats now and they’ve never turned it over despite chasing each other and running to jump on it. Great buy. Would buy from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: B Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great for cats, hard on human knees.
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this! It took him a bit to warm up to the hammock part, but now he spends at least half the day in there. He's a 19 lb fuzzball, but the large fits him just fine. One word of caution, however. It is NOT a good idea to bend over, put your arms around your cat and bury your face in his fur while he lies in the hammock. If your cat is like mine, they will like it so much that they command you to do this several times per day. Since the stand is not that tall, it's extremely hard on my knees to keep bending over and hugging him for any length of time!
customer_reviews.author: SWatson

customer_reviews.title: Kittens love it, might outgrow it though
customer_reviews.text: My kittens love this thing. They did grow out of using the scratching posts and the ball lasted less than a week, but they still love sleeping in and on it. Orangie will sleep in the bottom but only when it's cooler. As you can see in summer he prefers the shelf. The other two offer the hammock. I do wonder if they will eventually outgrow this. Already I had to buy a taller scratching post because when they no longer had to stretch to use these they lost interest. They're going to be big kitties as right now they are 5 months old and as you can see Orangie is too big for the hammock already.
customer_reviews.author: C. Spaight

customer_reviews.title: Apollo's favorite napping place :)
customer_reviews.text: This cat bed is super soft. Its easy to put together. Self explanatory and I didn't need instructions on how to put it together but it does come with the package. It arrived on time. My cat loves to sleep in his bed. Its super lightweight and can be transported to anywhere in the home. The scratch post is still going strong and I don't see it being replaced for awhile. The little ball attached to it is not very necessary but he will play with it once in awhile. It gets used every single day multiple times a day and is holding up very well. The price is right and I would recommend this cat bed for any cat.
customer_reviews.author: BluebunnyMH

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Cat Bed
customer_reviews.text: I love this cat bed. I have had several. They are very sturdy and have a simple clean design. Our cat loves the bed and sleeps in it every night. The structural pole are scratching posts. Our cat uses these daily. The bed itself dips down and cradles the cat. It is lightweight so it’s easy to move. I put a fluffy round rug inside the bed for extra comfort. I also like that it’s off the ground so the cat is not disturbed by the dogs. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: DKMom

customer_reviews.title: Took a while for cat to figure out but great!
customer_reviews.text: It is a year after we first purchased this for our cat. He used the scratching poles with gusto. He even sat under the hammock. But he did NOT understand how to use the actual hammock! Well my husband and I have been setting him on it frequently and I guess he just figured it out because we just looked over and BAM! he was curled up asleep in it! It took a year, but he did it! Maybe he'll figure out the pom pom next lol
customer_reviews.author: User737

customer_reviews.title: My cat is obsessed!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd one we’ve bought for my Siamese mix over 2.5 years. It’s easy to assemble and pretty sturdy. My cat isn’t a senior, but the steps are helpful so her fat butt can get into the hammock more easily! I wish more cat furniture had steps like this. The best part is how much she loves to sleep in it (it’s her designated bed) and how she loves to destroy it! The sisal rope provides lots of fun scratchy times for her. I give her a 1.5 years before she tears this one up and I have to buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Ruby

customer_reviews.title: both my cats love sleeping in it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I can't seem to find a scratching post that doesn't tip over and thought this might be more stable with the two posts. I wasn't sure if either my cats would use the hammock part. I have one cat who NEVER uses a cat bed. Not only does it make a secure scratching post, but MUCH to my surprise, both my cats love sleeping in it, so much so that I am planning on buying a second one. I have had it for 3 months now and so far, so good! I am including pics of Fluff and Chloe sleeping in the bed!
customer_reviews.author: R. J. Mirabile

customer_reviews.title: Made for one but will hold two snuggle buddies!
customer_reviews.text: My cats simply love this hammock. I have a ~13lb orange and a ~11lb gray and white and as you can see from the photos they often like to snuggle up in the hammock together :-) They also use the posts as scratching posts and will sometimes lie underneath (on the furry base) and swat at the ball on the string. They loved the first one I bought (in the living room) so much that I had to order a second one for my bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: Karin Magnuson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect height for under the window viewing and sunbathing!
customer_reviews.text: Cat loves it, though it took her a while to feel safe standing in the canopy part since no flat secure bottom (she’s elderly). This also has a built in ladder/steps to help her climb up on her own, which she also likes sitting on when not in the canopy bed. It’s the perfect height just under the windowsill, most towers I looked at were a few inches too short for her to lay down while seeing outside. She loves the soft furry texture and it looks great in the living room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but how can quality control be this bad that they would be missing 2 of the total ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a replacement one. Original didn't hold up well, but I plan to move withing the next 6 months, so I planned to get rid of it then. The new one shipped missing one of the legs and the little play ball. I don't care about the little ball, but how can quality control be this bad that they would be missing 2 of the total 5 parts that come with this product?!!!! Last thing I needed to do on a Saturday was to repack it, print the return label and drop it off at UPS
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrific!!
customer_reviews.text: I really can't understand the bad reviews for this product. Although mine did not arrive with any instructions it's so easy to figure out that I got it assembled right away. If you assemble it correctly, it's does not wobble or anything. Is quite sturdy. I had purchased one of these items (at Goodwill; it was in brand new condition too) and my female cat Lexi fell in love with it! I got another kitten (Licorice) and he wanted to sleep in it too, so I bought one for him. Now my girl cat and my little boy cat each have one and they love them!!
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: Cute, cuddly, comfortable, and strong!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was the first scratching post bed combo I got for our cat. She spends most of her time outside in our woods so never needed one, but started scratching the furniture. It’s taken her a while to warm up to it but it’s very appealing to her. It’s strong enough to hold my 4 yo daughter which sometimes uses it as a seat. It took me all of 2 minutes to put together and looks great with our furniture and sits right in our living room but small enough to fit in a corner. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie Kappeler

customer_reviews.title: Nice for kittens
customer_reviews.text: This little cat tree was just the right size for the four kittens. Two or three of them were able to curl up together in the top hammock. I put a sheepskin kitty bed on the bottom platform so they could use that too, otherwise the bottom is worthless for anything other than structure. The fuzzy ball is also worthless as it is not easily seen or reached. None of the kittens played with it. I found this cat tree to be nice and solid. It was cute seeing the kittens curled up together in the hammock. Now that they are over three months old, they have pretty much outgrown it.
customer_reviews.author: T. D.

customer_reviews.title: Cat Nap Cozy
customer_reviews.text: My two six-month-old kittens love it! They nap in it together, fight between the hammock and fuzzy base, tag-team on the ball toy, and share scratchy time on the twin posts. If you're thinking of getting a scratch post, think again and go for this: Twice the post with way more ways your cat can enjoy it. Assembly is simple (although it came with no instructions). 1) Screw the two threaded scratch posts into the bottom of the hammock section. 2) align the bottom of each post with a hole at either corner of the base and insert/tighten a supplied screw through the holes in the base (hex wrench supplied). Done!
customer_reviews.author: William J. Weiss

customer_reviews.title: Great product, cat approved
customer_reviews.text: Great product, cat approved! One of my cats has become almost a permanent fixture in the hammock – she doesn’t even hang out with us anymore! Lol The other one that likes the hammock too is always walking away from it with a disappointed face or resigning himself to sitting in the basket below it because the hammock is already occupied – I might have to get another one. I placed a basket under the hammock since the base is dead space - now I have double-decker cats. I also placed it up high so they have a window view when using it, but I secured it to make sure it doesn't topple over.
customer_reviews.author: SuziRTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: My 4 cats couldn't live without these
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 of these Trixie Baza Hammocks and all 4 cats use them. Yes, there are cheaper versions of this out there and I've found out the hard way they are no where near the same quality. The Baza model is taller so the cat isn't squished trying to scratch on the sisal for one thing. The sisal is of better quality and the hammock itself (most importantly) is deep enough for the cat. The cheap ones are very shallow and the cat ends up 'laying on top' instead of inside the hammock.
customer_reviews.author: its_jane

customer_reviews.title: I was concerned about the cradle on the top not being large enough.
customer_reviews.text: Hard to put together, finally figured it out. None of these reviews reflect the product above, they are reviews from another product. Where are the reviews for this one? I don't think the top cradle is large enough for a large cat or they don't feel secure in it because it's not large enough. People might be allergic to the fur or the cats might be. My cat only went to the scratcher, and sat on the bottom platform, haven't climbed the stair or sat in the cradle, although I put him on it, he jumped off right away. Might have to get used to it. I will see and send back if the doesn't like it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: The hammock is a good size for my 10-pound cat
customer_reviews.text: The hammock is a good size for my 10-pound cat, and she loves it! She's barely left it since I set it up and refuses to share with the other cat. Both cats like the scratching posts, and it's stable when one of the cats jumps up. There were no assembly instructions, but it's pretty intuitive. Just be sure to attach the posts to the hammock first, and then flip the whole thing upside down to add the base. You have to screw the posts into the hammock, so if you attach them to the base first, you'll have to start over. Not sure yet how durable it will be - will update.
customer_reviews.author: CBA

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product. I have a medium sized cat (probably 13 lbs) and he fits just fine! I like that there are 2 scratching posts so it doesn’t wear out as fast. I’ve only had it a week though so we will see how it holds up. It was pretty easy to put together. Not so sure I like the fuzzy base but that’s just my opinion. My kitty loves the scratching posts though and uses it all the time! It’s pretty wide though and it you put the base against the wall, basically one scratching post will be useless because of the angle. Good product for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlin Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Huge waste of money
customer_reviews.text: If zero stars were an option, I’d choose zero. First of all the box was damaged so badly that someone in the shipping company must’ve wrapped it with tons of tape. Not too serious. Until I opened the box to begin putting it together...first of all no instructions. Picture seemed simple enough until I realized I’m missing several screws and even the pieces that I could screw in were so flimsy it wouldn’t have mattered. This is going straight into the trash.
customer_reviews.author: JamieHuebner

customer_reviews.title: Kitten tested and approved.
customer_reviews.text: Love this! My kitten took a few days to start using it, but once she discovered it, she's in the hammock all the time, either sleeping, hanging out, or playing with the fuzzy ball. The tree doesn't come with instructions, but assembles pretty quickly. (Tip: First attach the hammock to the columns, then attach the columns to the base. It comes with an Allen wrench to tighten the screws.) I haven't had any of the issues mentioned in the other reviews (shedding materials, wobbly stand). It's sturdy and soft, the color is nice, and the price is even better. If you are buying this as a gift, be aware that the box has a huge photo of what's inside...
customer_reviews.author: amazonreview

customer_reviews.title: My Cat LOVES the hammock!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my cat, not knowing if it would be a good investment or not since you never know what a cat will like or not like! Luckily, the cat loves this! She is always sleeping in the hammock. The item comes disassembled and is easy to assemble, but for some reason it didn't come with the pom-pom that is pictured so I contacted the company and they have great customer service and are sending me another one with a pom-pom! I highly recommend this product, but as anyone with a cat knows, you can't predict what your cat will like or dislike!! For me, it turned out to be an excellent investment!
customer_reviews.author: Cakie

customer_reviews.title: As advertised, nice look, cat not interested
customer_reviews.text: Put the hammock together quickly and easily. Seems sturdy and stable enough for my cat, but for almost a week it has been sitting next to a mat she likes to lie on, and the only interest she has shown is to mark the posts with her cheeks. Since she hasnt actually got in it or even raised up on her hind legs to check it out, I did not give it 5 stars and splitting strurdy/stable assessment between 4 and 5.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to clean but my two cats love it so much.
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this bed. I have it next to my desk where I sit to work or play and they just come nap in it next to me. Often both cats will nap in the same bed (even though I have one for each of them!) -2 stars because it gets dirty very easily and is basically impossible to clean. Only a few months later and I will have to either throw it away or live with it looking disgusting. A horrible design that they could have so easily fixed by making it possible to remove the hammock to wash it.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: My Cat Loves This
customer_reviews.text: Assembly instructions are AWFUL with a capital A, AWFUL; it is assembled from the top down, not bottom up. Be sure and anchor it tight because it the bolts will loosen and if it's a bolt in the middle, it's a pain to disassemble and reassemble from the top down. However, my cat loves this. She is 15 yo and the steps make it easy for her to ascend.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sylvester

customer_reviews.title: Loved it till it broke
customer_reviews.text: The fluff ball didn't last too long attached to the bed but Asher loved to carry it around. He loved the bed and slept in it a lot. It's a bit of a pain to clean off the cat hair (he's a black long hair), but a rubber glove helps immensely. The 'fluffy' look gets worn out quickly from use so it can look a little shabby after some time. Unfortunately, I tended to use it as a foot stool too many times and it eventually broke. Very durable for cats though. I'll probably buy another one once I have the money.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Our kitty seems to like it so far!
customer_reviews.text: Our kitty seems to like it but she's not on it everyday, altho she does use the scratching post more than the hammock. Overall, it's good cause she outgrew her previous bed and the hammock seems comfy for her. My 12 year old daughter put it together. We should've put the post on the hammock first but it still feels stable and sturdy enough. Price is not bad, so overall, it was a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy K.

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this 3 stars not because it was a bad or deffective product but because it just wasn't what I was wanting. I didn't measure my window heigth prior to purchasing so it was way to short for where I was wanting to use it. It was pretty simple to put togther though and it seems to be well made. I would purchase this product again if I needed a smaller stand.
customer_reviews.author: Tara E. Pruitt

customer_reviews.title: Kittens/Cat Just Briefly Interested
customer_reviews.text: This small cat tree was indeed sturdy and easy to assemble. However, my new kittens only showed interest in it for about 2-3 weeks, when they were about 7 or 8 weeks old. For that brief period, the kittens did like to climb up in the bowl area and sleep/wrestle in the fuzzy base. And my mama cat will still occasionally sharpen her claws on the ropy posts. But for the most part, now that the kittens are 12 weeks old, the tree just mainly sits by itself, unused.
customer_reviews.author: riverscircus

customer_reviews.title: Well Made
customer_reviews.text: With some of the reviews, I was worried. This was easy for me to put together. Mine came with direction as well. It is sturdy and well thought out. The two posts keep it stable. (I have had single posts that have fallen and that was "it" for the cat!) The cat hammock is strong enough for a pretty large cat. The white color is also nice, as it fits in anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: My cats love this. I ended up buying a second to ...
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this. I ended up buying a second to avoid the squabbles they had over who got to lounge when. They look so adorably cozy in the little hammocks, and they definitely scratch the heck out of the sisal posts, but they show no major signs of wear. They're pretty easy to keep clean. I vacuum them periodically, base and sling. They still look new, honestly. The cats have other condos for lounging and those look much grubbier and collect way more hair. This one is cute and fluffy. The best trick is to tickle their behinds from underneath the hammock. They go nuts trying to figure out how we're doing that.
customer_reviews.author: Astrid

customer_reviews.title: Our kitten loves this stand the most!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far our kittens favorite place to play and sleep, we have 3 ranging in size and function. She took right to the scratching posts and loves to sleep in the hammock, in every position imaginable. She actually plays with the little ball on the side, I didn't think she would. Assembly was simple. I will say, this is probably intended for a smaller cat. Ours is 4.5lbs and fits great right now not I can't imagine at 12lbs but we'll see! Great price for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice.
customer_reviews.text: My two cats had different reactions to the tree. Fluid cat prefers to sleep in areas that have more give, soft pillows, and blankets. Loaf cat prefers harder surfaces like the counter and wicker. So it seems that one type of cat is more suited to this tree. We do have a problem with the liquid cat pouring out of the hammock head first as he is a giant slightly chubby boy that likes to spread out, at least 15 pounds. I would say that is the cap, 20 inches, and 15 pounds. It gets 4 stars because of ease of assembly, it leaned slightly but I fixed it.
customer_reviews.author: Cakesmith

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: My cat likes this, but not for its intended purpose, which is likely just her being stubborn; she is a cat after all. She won't sit on the top where the hammock is, but will only sit on the bottom (see photo). But she does use the scratching post, so it's all good. :) I’ve recently rescued a Persisn who, although large, seems to like sleeping scrunched up in the hammock. It was easy to put together and they send it with an allen wrench. No directions but it's easy enough to figure out as there is only the top, bottom, and two posts. It has a soft plush material that she seems to like to lay on.
customer_reviews.author: S. SmithTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Love it!  We're on our second one!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased our first one in 2012, our second in 2019. Our first one did what it was supposed to. Leo the cat destroyed both towers, the rope was absolutely shredded. But - that is what they were there for, better than my furniture. I decided to get a new one because the sling was looking a little worn. Otherwise I could have wrapped the towers with some new rope. Absolutely love it and glad I could buy one just like the previous! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Bee Happy

customer_reviews.title: Zen place for my black devil cat
customer_reviews.text: My rescued ferral kitten absolutely loves this thing. I caught him sleeping in our clothes drying rack after trying to get him more traditional types of cat beds. There isn’t much to it, but it has held up over the past year. My devil cat has knocked it over in his more playful fits, but I just woke up to him sleeping in it in our transition apartment as me move back to the U.S. I just ordered another one and shipped it to where we’ll be staying stateside. This hammock represents my little black cat’s zen place. It’s been my best buy for him yet.
customer_reviews.author: E. Y. Valko

customer_reviews.title: It's ok, probably worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Initially, it was great! The cats loved it, especially laying on the hammock. They also enjoyed the scratch post. The thing is that in less than a year, the scratch post is falling apart. And it's not due to wear like you'd expect after awhile. It literally just is coming off the post which is annoying so if you don't mind tossing and replacing in a year or less, go for it. If you a have an active cat(s)/kitten(s), I'd go with something more durable, though. Mine aren't super hyper/active, only one that's on the younger side, and still, this hasn't lasted what I'd hoped/expected it to last.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: My Cat's New Home!!
customer_reviews.text: My cat LOVES this cat tree. She immediately hopped in the hammock and has only left there to eat or go to the litter box. I think she'd eat there if we would hand feed her! It only took a few minutes to put together and she is in heaven. She loves to play with the hanging ball, and she sometimes sits on the bottom (if she's had to get up for some reason), but 90% of the time she's in that hammock. She loved it from the minute we put it in front of her. Highly recommend. She weighs 15 lbs. and so far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Pat S.

customer_reviews.title: Happy Kitty, Happy Mommy!
customer_reviews.text: My 12lb ball of black fluff LOVES her bowl! She used to have this massive cat castle that took up half of our dining room, but she really was only interested in the bowl. She would sleep in it all day, but eventually it got worn out and was just taking up too much space, so I got her this for Christmas. I honestly feel like she loves this way more. It’s a little bigger and the tops of the posts are cushioned like little pillows for her cheeks. She’s currently sleeping in it now snoring away. I’m SOO happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for regular size cats and kittens
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a fantastic tree. The cat loves it and tears it up and it is still standing. The basket is soft and the cat loves it, but cat is approaching 12 pounds and will probably outgrow the hammock part soon. If your cat is under ~12 pounds it should be good to go for the life of the cat. In other words, if it isn't a Maine Coon, you'll be fine. Easy to assemble and very durable. Matches color on screen very well.
customer_reviews.author: ntech1

customer_reviews.title: Entertainment center
customer_reviews.text: The Trixie was easy-peasy to assemble and attractive. Nevertheless, Maggie Mae didn't like it. Then I placed it inside the French doors and she discovered that she could lie in it secretly and observe the birds, squirrels and lizards going about their busy days on the patio. I can always locate her settled down in the hammock, waiting for a squirrel or a lizard to come strolling by while she watches and chatters to herself. Tons of excitement for a kitten. She loves this bed. I highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Aunt Winnie

customer_reviews.title: Great Thing for a Smallish Cat
customer_reviews.text: My cat likes it. It took him about a week to decide to sleep in the hammock. After that he uses it rather regularly. Unlike many people here, I do not know my cat's exact weight, but he is smallish; and he fills the hammock to the brim, see the pictures. I would not recommend the tree for large cats; they will spill over. The cat uses the scratch post regularly and vigorously. He even moves the tree around while scratching. And of course he tore off the pompom rather soon, but who cares? He now uses it off line.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kadaner

customer_reviews.title: My cat likes it.company needs to write step by step instructions.
customer_reviews.text: it was very hard to assemble. If there was a step by step instructions,it would made assemble much easier. I had to put together and dis assemble 3 times before I realized that you have to start it from the top.
customer_reviews.author: drosipova

customer_reviews.title: Cats' favorite scratcher, durable (lasted over a year), and fits in the car
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this cat hammock in October 2017 and it lasted until January 2019. It's still technically usable, but my cats always go for the top of the scratching posts, and it finally came unwound at the top of both sides. We always bring this in the car and one of the two will sleep in it for hours. They love it, it's durable, and doesn't take up too much space. I'm about to buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Alex C.

customer_reviews.title: Comfort for my cat, pretty for me
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 because I have 2 Persians. I set one up in front of the bedroom window and one in front of the dining room window. They are the perfect height for my windows, which are 15" above the floor. One of my cats, the female, hopped in right away. She stayed for 8 hours. 8 hours! My other cat, the male, seems to prefer his "pouf" bed. I wasn't sure how they would look, but am very pleased . They blend in with my decor nicely, looking better in person than in the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Suzeanna

customer_reviews.title: Cat approved
customer_reviews.text: It took less than 5 minutes to put together, even with the cat "helping". He immediately knew it was his and didn't want to wait for me to put it together. One of the other cats has tried to use the scratching post and he swatted him away. 😂😂😂😂 Definitely approved by the cat. I'm personally impressed with how well made it is. The hammock frame is a very very very sturdy metal. I foresee this lasting until the cats literally scratch it apart. Cat shown is a large 7 month old. He's gonna be a big boy when he's full grown.
customer_reviews.author: C. Shook

customer_reviews.title: My cats love it!
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought one for the family room and then I liked it so much I bought another for the bedroom. I sprinkled some catnip on the posts and from then on, the kittens just used the posts to scratch and not the furniture. The double posts obviously make it less prone to tipping. I have two kittens and so they both can scratch simultaneously. I like the color and most importantly, the cats love ALL of it. Its also very easy to assemble, just be careful of the roughness of the jute when twisting the posts into the base and hammock.
customer_reviews.author: Health Conscious

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this so much they fight over it. The scratching posts are great, they have something to scratch that isn't my furniture. The hammock is comfy and big enough for my two 10lb cats to share it. Assembly is a piece of cake, just screw it in. I might order another one just so they can have one upstairs and one downstairs.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price! My 16 lb cat fits on the top. She also likes to sit on the carpeted part because she feels like she’s hiding, with the hammock above her head. She won’t scratch a traditional scratching post so I wrap the poles in cardboard. For a true cat tree, I decided to make my file cabinet a place for her to lounge. I put a blanket on top and she’s able to lay and look out the window. With my file cabinet and this, there is no need for a massive, ugly cat tree.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: My cats love this little tree!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have enough money or space to buy a big cat tree so I settled for this little guy. The quality is great, very sturdy and durable but the material is super soft and plush. Super easy to put together also. I have two cats, one sleeps in the basket almost 24/7 she loves it so much! My boy mostly likes to hide in the bottom and sharpen his claws on the scratching posts. The little toy on the side is kind of pointless because the string is so short, but I bet if my kitties were still kittens they would play with it. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Four Out of Five Cats Give this Hammock 5 Stars!
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 large cats (about 12-14 lbs. each) and four out of five of them cycle through sleeping in the cat tree/hammock at different times during the day. And even though I have a variety of other cat trees and beds around the house, this hammock is by far their favorite. The hammock is just the right size for them to curl up in. So with that in mind, I finally ordered two more to place strategically around the house. The cat tree/hammock is very easy to put together -- takes only minutes. It is also very sturdy. We've had the original cat tree for about 3 or 4 months and it is holding up very nicely.
customer_reviews.author: D J R

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality product
customer_reviews.text: First of all, they don’t send instructions. They were able to send a note that indicated a possibility of no instructions and where to find them, but no instructions? Whatever. I went online and found them, not a big deal. Assembly is literally three steps, but it’s impossible because of the two blocks of wood on the sides, my allen key is not able to go in a full circle to tighten the screw... (yes, i’m holding the shorter side). I’ve put together more complex trees in less time. The quality is just not great. The box came completely destroyed, the tree looks cheap and used. I’m really not happy, and would recommend BEWISHOME (?) for your cat tree needs.
customer_reviews.author: mikele

customer_reviews.title: It’s white and my cats love playing on it and sleeping in it!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best cat scratching post and bed!!! My cats favorite and loves the ball hanging from top! For such a reasonable price I am so happy with it! I wish they would make one a little higher! I have white furniture and so hard to find white cat furniture. I love it and highly recommend this furniture.
customer_reviews.author: nifty2522

customer_reviews.title: My cat doesn't love this product
customer_reviews.text: My cat doesn't love this product, but he uses it. He likes to sit on the bottom portion and look out the window, and he will very occasionally sit in the hammock. He doesn't use the scratching posts too much, but he does scratch the bottom regularly. I like this product - it's super cute, and my cat does seem to enjoy it at least sometimes. He's a pretty lazy guy, though, so maybe a different cat would like this better. It does come in different pieces, but it is VERY easy to put together. Took no effort AT ALL.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: A$AP Minkles' Spot For Plotting, Napping, and Scrapping
customer_reviews.text: My bengal cat absolutely loves this thing. She uses it as one of her permanent cat nap spots in between her dedicated hours of plotting to kill the humans of the house. After her 8 hour nap, she scratches the sides like they owe her money and then reaches over the top hoping to reach a toy she forgot about from 20 seconds prior. The only downside is that she ripped that ball off within a day - due to the stare it gave her. Instead of the ball on the cat hammock, it now doubles as her fetch ball, so win-win-win as Michael Scott would say. Bottom line, A$AP Minkles loves this thing, and your cat will too.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Christianson

customer_reviews.title: Great for my kitty!
customer_reviews.text: Kitty wanted to be all over this thing the moment we took it out of the box. He loves the hammock, but doesn't use the bottom part much. Probably because it is so hot outside. I saw other comments saying to assemble to top first before the base and I 100% agree, it is the only way to do it. Very soft and glad I spent the money on this for my little guy ❤️
customer_reviews.author: Mariah McCorkle

customer_reviews.title: Even the most apathetic cat loves this
customer_reviews.text: I have a jaded Miami street cat. He doesnt like cuddles, he doesn't wasnt treats, doesn't care for fancy foods or beds. He just wants to be left alone to sleep on a chair. he has 3 things in life that bring him absolute joy. Cat nip, licking his balls, and this bed. He loves it. Its honestly his favorite place in the house. He loves scratching it, sleeping in it, bathing in it, getting nip high in it. 100% recommend
customer_reviews.author: Sweetestmuffins

customer_reviews.title: Great cat bed!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves sleeping on it, but I can't get her to scratch the posts. She's still using my easy chair 😕 I don't think that the posts are tall enough to let her stretch on it. However, I also tried a cardboard scratcher that I attached to the wall and that's a no-go, too. This may be more of a cat thing than a product thing. Overall, I love the plush shag fabric. It doesn't look bad with the rest of my furniture. It also seems to pretty sturdy so far. The whole thing came unassembled without instructions, but it wasn't very hard to deduce how to put it together.
customer_reviews.author: Customer X

customer_reviews.title: Too small for big cats
customer_reviews.text: Purchased thinking it would be a nice kitty hammock, because my cats so enjoy lying on my mesh clothes drying rack when I let them, but they will not even try out the Baza Cat tree. I think they would fit if they tried; perhaps there is something about the design that makes the hammock part look precarious to them. This cat tree was not a total failure however, as the cats do very much like scratching the posts, but it did not free up my drying rack for sweaters. The tree now has a place of honor near the couch they used to scratch.
customer_reviews.author: afficionado

customer_reviews.title: Cats love sleeping in this!
customer_reviews.text: Great scratcher, perfect sized for my 12lb or 9lb cat to nap in the basket. Bought it for the little one and he loves it. He spends day and night in this bed. The bigger one loves the sisal scratching posts and he hasn't knocked it over in the six months I've had it. I love that they love this. I am planning on buying another one so my cat can be comfortable and near by when I move rooms! Probably best for a cat who likes observing, rather than one who's always nearby.
customer_reviews.author: SterlingSilver

customer_reviews.title: Small !!
customer_reviews.text: This stand is great for a kitten. I would not recommend it for an adult cat. I have two cats... one is 7 pounds, the other is 13 pounds. The 7 pound cat barely fits in the hammock and neither of them like it... refuse to lay in it! They do however like the scratching posts. It is well made and sturdy/balanced.
customer_reviews.author: Island Girl

customer_reviews.title: Be careful where you place this.
customer_reviews.text: This may suit a playful cat or kitten better instead of an older kitty. I have 2 cats both 5 years old and even with spraying catnip, they ignored it. The problem I think is, that there's not really enough room when they jump up to land on something stable. It's like jumping up directly from a suspended hammock. It's uncomfortable sensation. I think if you want to position this next to a stable furniture like the sofa, it may work. There's also the issue of cats liking high places and/or preferring to snuggle with their humans (ie. on their lap even when there's a giant sofa next to them), ignoring that brand new cat bed completely.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it!! But stiching has come undone after only 2 months.
customer_reviews.text: -1 star as the hammock is coming apart at the seam after only 2 months of owning. Cats love this, and love sleeping in the hammock. Both of my cats are getting close to 1-1/2 years old and fit just fine. One is often jealous of the one sleeping in the hammock. Our larger cat weighs about 12-14 pounds, so maybe this is the cause of the stitching to come undone, but I would think it should hold as there is no limits listed. But I have removed one star for this happening after only 2 months. I may still order a second so they both can sit in one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase for an old cat!
customer_reviews.text: The hammock was easy to put together...I put the legs onto the base first, obviously I didn't look at the instructions very closely! However, it's very easy to put together and once it's done, it's very sturdy. My cat is about 12lbs and she fits very comfortably into the hammock. At 13 years old, she still runs and jumps, but is picky about cat trees/condos. She checked this one out on day 1 and has been in it multiple times a day every day since then. She loves looking out the window, taking naps, and has even abandoned me at night to sleep there! This has been a very successful purchase for my sweet, old girl!!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole K.

customer_reviews.title: CAT  “CLASS ACT” STAND !!!
customer_reviews.text: This SWANKY cat stand is GREAT! At first GOLDIE wd only use scratch post and play w ball.... then one Day I came into room and VIOLA !!! He ❤️‘S it ... to look out window he does have to stand on hind feet ... was somewhat disappointed with it not being high enough BUT this way he gets his exercise for all the sleep 💤 time he seems to have after playing w all his queaky mice and running to NO WARE...., XOXO ❤️ him ....a mild mannered guy ..,. got him at Second Chance Adoption and now he’s THE LICKIEST CAT IN THE WORLD ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️ SPOILED ROTTEN!!!!
customer_reviews.author: deeroz

customer_reviews.title: Was anxious, but am now THRILLED!!
customer_reviews.text: We have one cat and I was anxious about the short stature of this 'squatty' tree, since prior cat tree was like a room size jungle gym!! Moving to a small apartment in NYC didn't allow for our older big cat tree. However, upon unboxing the little 'squatty' tree, our Kitteh recognized the sisal pillars for taking care of his clawing instincts and from there on out the 'squatty' tree was loved and adored!!! He sleeps all the time in his Sherpa-like nest, curled as snug as a bug!! Easy to put together, easily portable, small foot print, yet overwhelmingly satisfying!!!
customer_reviews.author: Terry C

customer_reviews.title: Made cats very happy!
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this. Put the smaller cat in the hammock and she settled right in. Big cat hasn't stopped playing with the ball. I'll have to get another one to keep the crew happy. Only complaint is no instructions were included. I had to assemble and reassemble the unit because, unless you screw the legs into the hammock before putting on the base, there is no way to make the hammock stable. Once I realized you had to start with attaching the hammock everything went smoothly and it's now sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: SalukiTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Nice but finicky kitties might not appreciate their new, fun, soft place to play and sleep!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two. Unfortunately, despite being stable and providing sleep and play options for my kitties, neither paid any attention to them. Both were afraid of the hammocks and were disinterested in the caves. Additionally, if you don't have Prime, you'll get whacked over $25 bucks to return.
customer_reviews.author: ExoticMunchi

customer_reviews.title: New Cat "Winnie" Loves the Hammock Bed!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little leery before buying this as I needed something that would prevent "Winnie" from scratching the corner of the couch. Well, my husband hardly had a chance to put it down after putting it together and she was scratching away !!! She didn't notice the hammock right away....too interested in batting the ball around! Finally the second day she jumped into the hammock and absolutely LOVES it ! Last night she put on such a show for us, turning upside down and hanging her head way down...it was hysterical! I highly recommend this for ALL ages of cats...and the Price is Right and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Carole Doyle

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it! I wish I had gotten this for him ages ago
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical because I've had other cat trees on the past that weren't very sturdy. I got the Baza Senior specifically because my kitty loves hammocks. Before I could even fully assemble he was scratching on the posts and climbing all over. Once I set it up, he hopped in the hammock top and stayed there for hours. It's his new special perch for the office, so he doesn't step all over the keyboards while we're working now. The assembly was easy, it feels very secure (metal bolts are pretty thick and have good threading). This one's a win.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Finally likes it! Update: defective cat
customer_reviews.text: Got this for our cat for Christmas, and he loved the bottom and the scratch posts. Took him 4 weeks, but he finally is in the hammock. He won’t get out LOL. Really easy to put together and he weighs 11 lbs and it holds him easily. Probably even enough room for another cat. Update: The jerk cat has never gotten into the hammock part again. He now lives in the box it came in. Might be exchanging our cat, I think he’s defective.
customer_reviews.author: FnH

customer_reviews.title: They love sitting in their hammock and looking out the windows
customer_reviews.text: This is the third one I have purchased for our Maine Coones! They love sitting in their hammock and looking out the windows. The interior construction is fairly solid, however, they do break down after time and much use. The first one I bought, after it failed, I cut the fabric off to see how it was constructed and the wood used is a type of particle board, which is what gave out. However, we do have very large kitties, so it was not an issue for us. The price is low and easily replaced with another one. Our furbabies really do love them, so I will keep replacing as needed or until they no longer seem to enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: AHorrell

customer_reviews.title: ... this one would be too small to keep them happy, but they really like it
customer_reviews.text: My cats had a huge kitty condo with multiple levels and I was worried this one would be too small to keep them happy, but they really like it. I almost cut off the bouncy ball thing, thinking they wouldn't care less about it, but sooo glad I didn't--they play with it a lot! This is a decent quality cat tree. My only caution is to be careful when putting this together because the scratching posts are very scratchy (guess they live up to their name).
customer_reviews.author: DanielleM

customer_reviews.title: She Loves It So I Love It!
customer_reviews.text: My runty kitten loves this thing. It took her longer than I thought it would for her to get used to it. But now she sleeps in it all day. I may call her ‘my kitten’ but she is a pretty big cat (about 14 pounds... NOT FAT you friggin jerks), this fits her perfectly. She snuggles in and purrs away. It assembles well, the two posts screwing into place on the bottom piece. She loves the rope wrapped around the posts/columns as well and rubs her paws on it all the time. I definitely foresee this thing lasting a good long time. Buy with confidence my beautiful people!
customer_reviews.author: B.O.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My cats absolutely love this thing. I have 2 cats and each fight for the spot. Sometimes one sits on the bottom even though it’s not a seat but they love it so. It’s easy to put together and small enough to put in a corner and not be in the way. Once my cats scratch the heck out of this I’m definitely gonna get another one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Though the construction is sturdy, I was greatly disappointed by the ring supporting ...
customer_reviews.text: Though the construction is sturdy, I was greatly disappointed by the ring supporting the top material, as it's a hard, metal tube. The material offers zero cushioning over the metal ring. The faux fur is also not fabulous. I'd have given less than 3 stars, but it seems quite sturdy, the jute covering the posts is tight and well made, plus it's not an expensive item. Once our kittens are older / larger, I will likely remove the top material, cover the metal tube using a "pool ring", then recover it myself - as it won't prove comfortable for adult cats and any legs that hang over the edges.
customer_reviews.author: GrammaC in NC

customer_reviews.title: Nice tree - Missing assembly instructions
customer_reviews.text: Nice tree - good price. But missing assembly instructions. They actually include a piece of paper that talks about if you are missing instructions, go to their website to download the instructions... clearly they have issues getting those instructions included (mine of course were missing). The website is broken. But google and go to the german website (in english) to get the instructions. Really straight forward - you can probably guess without the instructions too. Together in 2-3 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great bed-this was our 2nd purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This was our second purchase of this cat tree! Our three cats were so obsessed with it that we had to buy another for our upstairs. Huge hit-our new cat, Hudson, who is about 6 months old and weighs about 6 lbs spends the most time in the bed. Kayla, our oldest cat, weighs about 13 lbs and even fits in the bed. It's not a bed for larger cats. If your cat weighs 13-14 lbs or less then I would recommend this bed. It's super soft and the cats love to lie on it.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie in Austin

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: My cats don't use their trees. They like my lap, couch or my bed or manage to climb the high three column bookshelf for height. The trees were just an ugly hindrance. They do however use this to sleep on when I am working at my desk which is great. Its small enough to not be in the way and still useful with the scratch posts.
customer_reviews.author: Mudds

customer_reviews.title: great design and value
customer_reviews.text: very reasonable price. stable , my large other cat scratches full strength and it never topples. cats love the hammock. just add a little pad/foam/towel on base because thin fur on wood base. posts are one piece, more stability and no wiggle, as opposed to competition. highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: R. Terrance Stanton DPM LTC(ret)

customer_reviews.title: Great Hammock
customer_reviews.text: Make sure to follow the directions carefully, because it's sort of a pain to assemble. However, my cat absolutely loves this cat tree. She had been sitting on my nice arm chair for two years, I assembled this hammock and within two days she started sitting in it 24/7. I haven't seen her on my arm chair since purchasing this, and that was about 7 months ago. She loves it so much I am buying a second! The only frustrating thing is that you can't remove the top hammock part and throw it in the wash.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Kitty LOVES this hammock/hideout
customer_reviews.text: I secured it to the wall on top of my tall dresser that's in a corner of my room. My cat now has a secure place to sleep of reach from the dogs and little kids. Kitty absolutely loves her comfortable and soft little hideaway. Update 1 year later and I'm so happy I bought this for my cat, she LOVES this thing. When it's cold she goes in the cubby hole and when it's hot she lounges up on top in the hammock. If this ever breaks I'm buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Carrasco

customer_reviews.title: Cat uses it as a scratcher
customer_reviews.text: Happy to say the cat has stopped scratching at the sofa and uses this instead. She doesn't use the hammock, but really likes scratching at the posts. A little catnip on them when I first set it up probably helped. It's not the most elegant fabric, but I can tuck it in a corner.
customer_reviews.author: ShopsALot

product_meta.title: Trixie Baza Grande, Baza Senior, Scratching Post, Cat Tree with Hammock
product_meta.description: Color:Original Baza, creamThe Baza Cat Hammock will provide endless opportunities for cats to play and scratch or just relax. Felines can sharpen their claws on any one of two scratching posts instead of on your furniture or carpet, giving them a healthy outlet for their scratching instincts. All posts are covered in durable sisal. For a nap or a cozy retreat, the cat can curl up in the cozy hammock which is covered with ultra plush material both inside and out. It also has a metal rim for added support. Cats can bat around the dangling pom-pom toy for added fun. Suitable for cats of all ages and activity levels. One year warranty. Color: cream. Dimensions (inches): 16 x 16 x 20; posts 3.5 diameter; hammock 20 x 20. Weight: 10 pounds.
feature_bullets: Wrapped in soft long-haired plush fabric
Hammock with metal rim for added support

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
